record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff Second Revised Volume No. 1
record_data.record_plain_text:
Electrade Corporation FERC FPA (MBR) Electric Tariff, Second Revised Rate Schedule No. 1 Effective April 21, 2010
1. Availability: Electrade Corporation (“Electrade” or “Seller”) makes electric energy and capacity available under this Rate Schedule for wholesale sales to purchasers with whom Electrade has contracted. 2. Applicability: This Rate Schedule is applicable to all jurisdictional sales of electric energy or capacity by Electrade not expressly subject to a different Rate Schedule of Electrade. 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Electrade. 4. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions of sale shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and Electrade. 5. Effective Date: This Rate Schedule is effective as of the date specified by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. 6. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Seller’s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Seller to engage in affiliate sales under this Rate Schedule or otherwise restricts or limits Seller’s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Seller’s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this Rate Schedule. 7. Seller Category. Seller is a Category 1 seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a). 8. Limitations and Exemptions, Waivers and Blanket Authorizations. (a) Limitations: Not applicable (b) Electrade has been granted waiver of the following Commission Regulations: (i) Subparts B and C of Part 35 (regarding the filing of rate schedules), except Sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16; (ii) Part 41 (regarding accounts, records and memoranda); (iii) Part 101 (regarding the Uniform System of Accounts); and Part 141 (regarding statements and reports). Electrade Corp., Docket No. ER94-1478-000, at 1 (Aug. 25, 1994) (unpublished letter order). (c) Electrade has been granted blanket authorization under Part 34 of the Commission’s Regulations for issuances of securities and assumptions of liabilities. Electrade Corp., Docket No. ER94-1478-000, at 1 (Aug. 25, 1994) (unpublished letter order).
